article.headline: Long Beach St. 77, Loyola Marymount 52
article.story: LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) -- Donavan Morris scored 22 points and Brian Freeman added 17 to lead Long Beach State to a 77-52 victory over Loyola Marymount University Wednesday. Morris made four of five shots and scored nine points to give Long Beach State (2-5) a 35-31 lead at the break. He added 13 more points during the 49'ers' 20-8 run to start the second half. His two free throws extended the team's lead to 55-39 with 10:17 left in the game. Freeman made six of seven shots and grabbed a career-high 10 rebounds for the 49'ers, who snapped a three game losing streak. Shawn Deadwiler scored 16 points and Orlando Johnson added 11 for the Lions (2-7). The 49'ers shot 50 percent (28-56) for the game. The Lions shot 18-50 (36 percent) for the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
